Days after the stunning ruling regarding eminent domain, the Supreme Court has once again made a ruling in favour of big business.
 It has ruled that people that make filesharing programs can be held liable when someone else uses the programs to download pirated music/movies/software/etc. This makes about as much sense as holding a car company responsible when someone uses a car as a getaway vehicle for a bank robbery.
 Apparently the Supreme Court is unaware of the myriad of legal music, movie and software files that are shared between Internet users each day.
 This ruling will be a serious blow to innovation on the Internet since nobody in his right mind will now develop new software because they fear they might get sued over something which they have no control over.
 
 I wonder how much it cost MGM to get this ruling in their favour...

It has ruled that people that make filesharing programs can be held liable when someone else uses the programs to download pirated music/movies/software/etc.

 This makes about as much sense as holding a car company responsible when someone uses a car as a getaway vehicle for a bank robbery
